lines.content: * Entry point of the Helio task manager application.
* Helio is a simple CLI-based task manager that supports commands such as:
* adding tasks (todo, deadline, event), listing tasks, marking/unmarking,
* deleting, searching, and saving/loading tasks from disk.
* Constructs a {@code Helio} app that uses the given save file.
* @param fileDir  directory where the save file is stored
* @param fileName name of the save file
storage.load(tasks); // load tasks if file exists
* Runs the main command loop of the application.
* Reads user input from the UI.
* Parses the input into a {@code Command}.
* Executes the command, updating tasks and UI as needed.
* Saves the task list to disk when modified.
* Terminates when the user enters the {@code bye} command.
* Main entry point. Starts the Helio app with the default save file location.

* Represents a generic task with a textual description and a completion status.
* may add additional fields and override output formats.

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks this task as not done.
* Returns the description of this task.
* Returns whether the task is marked as done.

* Subclasses should override this method if they need to persist additional fields.

* Returns a human-readable representation for displaying in the UI.
* Encapsulates a mutable list of {@link Task}s and provides common operations
* such as add, delete, access, and keyword search.
* Acts as the single source of truth for tasks while the program is running.
private final ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();

* Returns the task at the given 0-based index.

* Utility methods for parsing and formatting dates and times used in tasks.
* - Date only: {@code MMM d yyyy} (e.g., Oct 3 2025)
* - Date + time: {@code MMM d yyyy HH:mm} (e.g., Oct 3 2025 18:00)
private static final DateTimeFormatter PRETTY_DATE = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy");
private static final DateTimeFormatter PRETTY_DATETIME = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy HH:mm");
private static final DateTimeFormatter FILE_DATE = DateTimeFormatter.ISO_LOCAL_DATE;            // yyyy-MM-dd
private static final DateTimeFormatter FILE_DATETIME = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
* Parses a date string in {@code yyyy-MM-dd} format.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the input cannot be parsed
* Parses a date/time string in either of the supported formats:
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the input cannot be parsed
"Invalid date/time: \"" + s + "\". Use yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-dd HHmm (e.g., 2025-10-03 1800)."
* Formats a {@code LocalDate} for user-facing display.
* @return a string in {@code MMM d yyyy} format (e.g., Oct 3 2025)
* Formats a {@code LocalDateTime} for user-facing display.

* Handles all user interaction for the Helio CLI:
* - printing normal messages, task lists, and errors
* - displaying confirmations when tasks are added, removed, or updated
private final Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);
* Reads one line of user input from standard input.
* @return the line read, or {@code null} if the input stream is closed
* Prints the welcome banner and a short greeting.
System.out.println(" What can I do for you? ._.");
System.out.println(" psssst if you don't know what I can do just enter the magic word --> help");
* Prints the goodbye message when the program exits.
System.out.println(" Bye bye! Time for my nap!! ");
* Prints the list of supported commands and their usage format.
* Prints a horizontal divider line for readability and formatting.
* @param message the error details to show
* Prints the last command entered by the user (for debugging/feedback).
* Prints all tasks in the list with 1-based indices.
* @param tasks the task list to display
System.out.println(" Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Prints the tasks that matched a search query.
* If the list is empty, prints a friendly "no matches" message.
* Otherwise, prints the matching tasks with 1-based indices.
* @param matches the task list containing only the matching tasks
System.out.println(" Here are the tasks in your list that match your keyword:");
* Prints the details of a newly added task and the updated total count.
* @param count the total number of tasks after the addition
public void showTaskAdded(Task t, int count) {
System.out.println(" Got it!! I've added this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + count + " tasks in your list.");
* Prints the details of a removed task and the updated total count.
* @param count the total number of tasks after the removal
public void showTaskRemoved(Task t, int count) {
System.out.println(" Meow!! I've removed this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list:)");
* Prints a confirmation that a task was marked as done.
* @param t the task that was marked as done
System.out.println(" Yay! I've meowed this task as done:");
* Prints a confirmation that a task was marked as not done.
* @param t the task that was unmarked
System.out.println(" Aww okay... I've meowed this task as not done yet:");
